div.head: Plants which are bad to burn in the mold
div.ab: Mold them in two or three castings; being annealed, your mold will open, and it will be easier to extract the charcoal from inside.

div.head: Letters and molded paper
div.ab: Write with some ink well thickened with gum or any other color dye which has body, and which is not erased if dampened with brandy. Then put your paper on the sheet of clay, and dampen it with brandy. Cast both sides of paper.

div.head: For adorning beds, mirrors and similar things
div.ab: Model any drawing in half relief on a flat slate in order to set it on round or flat things. Cast with very fine tin, then you can gild it with gold leaf, and set it wherever you want. Fill the bottom of the relief with small rubies, orpiment, or any colored little grains.

div.head: To teach a dog well
div.ab: You need to keep your dog attached; when it does what you command, to win its love, give it a piece of cheese that was held under the armpit. This cheese would be a bad drug if the master, or the apprentice, is red-haired.

div.head: Molded waxes
div.ab: Wax representations made from white lead and cerussite are not made to be burned and melted in a mold where you want to cast silver and gold; this would make it brittle. Moreover if you use such a mold, the wax would be stripped thanks to the violence of the fire which makes it boil, and the mixture made of cerrusite or any other metal would attack the mold.
